output.conclusion: Upon completion of this course, participants will be equipped with advanced analytical skills to drive data-informed decision-making, optimize business processes, and gain a competitive edge in today's data-driven environment.
output.introduction: Welcome to Advanced Business Analytics! This course is designed for professionals seeking to deepen their understanding of data analysis techniques and apply them to solve complex business problems. We will explore advanced statistical methods, predictive modeling, and data visualization to extract actionable insights and drive strategic decision-making.

chapters.description: A quick recap of mean, median, mode, standard deviation, and variance.
Understanding normal, binomial, and Poisson distributions.
Revisiting null and alternative hypotheses, p-values, and significance levels.
Building and interpreting regression models with multiple independent variables.
Assessing model fit, checking for multicollinearity, and handling outliers.
Introduction to Ridge, Lasso, and Elastic Net regression for model improvement.
Predicting binary outcomes using logistic regression models.
Understanding accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, and AUC-ROC.
Optimizing classification thresholds for specific business objectives.
Exploring K-Means, Hierarchical, and DBSCAN clustering techniques.
Using silhouette score and other metrics to evaluate cluster quality.
Customer segmentation, anomaly detection, and market basket analysis.
Decomposing time series data into trend, seasonality, and residuals.
Building and forecasting with Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA) models.
Using metrics like MAE, MSE, and RMSE to assess forecast performance.
Crafting compelling narratives with data visualizations.
Exploring tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Python libraries for data visualization.
Presenting analytical findings to diverse audiences.
